summary: This is an email chain from August 10, 2019, forwarding the official Bureau of Prisons statement announcing the death of Jeffrey Epstein. The statement reports Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York at approximately 6:30 a.m. and was later pronounced dead at a hospital. The FBI is investigating the incident.

persons.name: Jeffrey Edward Epstein
persons.context: The inmate found unresponsive in his cell at MCC New York on August 10, 2019, and later pronounced dead. He was being held on pretrial status for sex trafficking of minors and conspiracy.

persons.name: Geoffrey Berman
persons.role: U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York (USANYS)
persons.context: Recipient and forwarder of the email containing the BOP statement about Epstein's death. His office (USA) was discussed earlier that morning regarding the statement.

events.title: Death of Jeffrey Epstein at MCC New York
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell in the Special Housing Unit at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York at approximately 6:30 a.m. Life-saving measures were initiated, he was transported to a local hospital, and was subsequently pronounced dead. The FBI is investigating the incident as an apparent suicide.

events.title: Epstein arrives at MCC New York
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein arrived at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York under pretrial status after being indicted for sex trafficking of minors and conspiracy.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York, New York
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York on August 10, 2019, at approximately 6:30 a.m.
The incident was described as an 'apparent suicide' and Epstein was later pronounced dead at a local hospital.
The FBI is investigating the incident.
Epstein had been at MCC New York since July 6, 2019, under pretrial status for charges of sex trafficking of minors and conspiracy.
The email chain shows coordination between the FBI, the U.S. Attorney's Office (Geoffrey Berman), and the DOJ's Office of Public Affairs regarding the release of the official statement.
